plot: Trotters' Independent Trading is causing mayhem with their faulty RAJAH computers. Rodney gets a new job at a funeral director's, while Albert and Del hit the health market with their miracle-cure body massagers. At the wedding of Trigger's niece, the Trotters hear the tale of Freddy the Frog, a bank robber and close friend of the boys' mother. He left everything in his will to their mum, including missing gold bullion. While Del hunts for treasure, Rodney puzzles over Freddy and his mother's "friendship"--and a son who would by now be just his age.—Rune Thandy

At the wedding reception of Trigger's niece, Del meets his mother Joan's best friend Reenie, whom he's not seen since she moved to the coast, shortly after his mother's death. She tells him the story of Joan's man-friend, Freddie "The Frog" Robdal. Freddie was a gentleman crook, who apparently had left a substantial amount of stolen gold bullion to Joan in his will. Following her death, this gold would now be rightfully Del's. There's just one big problem: no-one knows where he stashed it, and it's been missing for all these years. Can Del finally become the millionaire he's always promised himself he'd be by solving the riddle of the Frog's Legacy?—stevecann2003
